metadata.title: CVE-2021-47624 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/sunrpc: fix reference count leaks in rpc_sysfs_xprt_state_changeThe refcount leak issues take place in an error handling path. When the3rd argument buf doesn't match with "offline", "online" or "remove", thefunction simply returns -EINVAL and forgets to decrease the referencecount of a rpc_xprt object and a rpc_xprt_switch object increased byrpc_sysfs_xprt_kobj_get_xprt() andrpc_sysfs_xprt_kobj_get_xprt_switch(), causing reference count leaks ofboth unused objects.Fix this issue by jumping to the error handling path labelled without_put when buf matches none of "offline", "online" or "remove".

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47624` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
